profileText: A Representative from New York; born in Kings County, N.Y., in 1781; attended the common schools; county clerk of Kings County 1816-1821 and 1822-1837; upon its organization was elected treasurer of the Brooklyn Savings Bank; elected as a Democrat to the Twenty-fifth Congress (March 4, 1837-March 3, 1839); was not a candidate for renomination in 1838; died in Brooklyn, N.Y., July 21, 1839; interment in Reformed Dutch Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: In the Schoonmaker Family Papers, ca. 1761-1915, 0.2 cubic foot.
1801-1837. 23 items.
researchRecord.description: Personal business papers. Finding aid in repository.
